Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but remote.”
Reviews.Author: MattArmb9
Reviews.Content: Very new and clean. Thought the staff was very helpful. Only complaint is there is NOTHING close by. I was dropped off by a work associate so I could catch a flight the next morning. Without a car, I had no choice but to eat at their restaurant. It was OK, but would have been nice to have some choices. I didn't have any problem with plane noise and I even stayed on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, heard no plane noise, excellent staff to boot.”
Reviews.Author: hodels
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night for business, and after the reveiws of plane noise I asked for a lower-floor room. I heard nothing from the airport - or maybe I just slept like a baby??!! Hotel is fairly new, and has been kept clean. Workout room clean also. Bar area in the hotel is very nice. Maybe 5 min or less to the airport, very convenient. It is NOT hard to find, right off Regan Pkwy on way out of the airport. A BIG thanks to JESSICA at the front desk, she was extremely helpful (I rarely deal much with the staff, but when you must - it is a bonus if they are good). Jessica was just plain awesome. I felt respected and appreciated and not once did I feel like my requests were annoying her (like often in hotels lately). Again - hotel is almost new and the cleanliness overall was great, even in common areas. Plenty of sitting space near lobby for small meetings as well. Business center had 3 stations, nice convenience for those crowded eve's!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great service, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Alex080856
Reviews.Content: I was on a two week project. This hotel was almost perfect. The only issue I had is the fact that I needed to drive minimum 10 minutes to the nearest restaurant. But I would stay again if need be,

Reviews.Title: “It's OK!”
Reviews.Author: latrell1
Reviews.Content: This relatively new hotel is in a relatively desolate area by the new airport, and as a result, it's easy to get lost. One cab driver from downtown Indy took me to the wrong hotel, while another had no idea where to go and insisted that I look up directions on my phone. Yikes. So make sure you know how to get back here yourself if you don't have a car. The hotel itself is comfortable, if without frills. The shuttle service from the airport is reliable, parking is plentiful, and if you do end up getting stuck at the hotel, the in-house restaurant is affordable and better than you might expect. Service was above-average, but you would never leave this hotel and think "I can't wait to get back!", which is more a function of its lot in life as opposed to anything wrong about the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for Indy airport,”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller2076
Reviews.Content: Near the 'new' access to Indianapolis airport. Still only 1 other motel nearby so it appears to be in the 'middle of nowhere', but well lit and easy to find. Checked in late and stayed 1 night to catch an early departure. Only met 1 reception clerk and 2 shuttle bus drivers, all efficient. Typical room, clean and reasonable size.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk, clean and dependable airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: GA_GAL13
Reviews.Content: We visited Indy in order to attend a Colts game. This hotel is about 10minutes from downtown. However, you can take free hotel shuttle to airport and at airport use IndyGo shuttle to reach downtown. I believe IndyGo was $7 per adult one way but still cheaper than cab. There is nothing near hotel so eat downtown. We did eat breakfast at the hotel and it was very good! Recommend this hotel. Very, very clean and front desk staff was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel quality brought down by employees”
Reviews.Author: IMJetlagged
Reviews.Content: I just do not understand large hotel chains in today's economic demise not focusing more on quality customer service to build and maintain a clientele for the future. Though this hotel is very well accommodated and clean the quality of it's staff dragged it down. I felt I was an intruder on their daily work lives. The bar attendant served my snack in a to go box and although the place was still open for a few hours proceeded to spray wood polish all around me to clean the bar ... sure, I'm glad they get the dusting done ... but then to keep banging my stool with the broom was pretty darn rude. There were no boundaries at breakfast I learned whose (staff) daughter was doing what and when and was asked 6 times if I was "doin' alright" while there was a dirty plate, bowl and cup stacking up and being ignored ... ignored like my wish for a pot of coffee. I chose to use up some Hilton honors points for this stay for two nights and they wanted 60,000 points .... again, that's SIXTY THOUSAND POINTS! I thought I might be staying at the Ritz Carlton on the beach with that installment ... but no ... it was an airport hotel with not one but TWO small bottles of complimentary water! What the heck? BAD idea - should have just stayed at the Holiday Inn Express and got the breakfast for free too. It was however better than the Crowne Plaza Indy Airport hotel I stayed at last month. Greatfully, I didn't have to wait long for the airport shuttle (this hotel IS basically in the middle of a corn field) I was told on the phone "... that I should have to put my name on the shuttle list" ... and not "We're looking forward to seeing you, let me see what I can do for you with regards to the shuttle service .... " Then the driver showed up in less than 10 minutes and had only one other passenger to pick up. SERIOUSLY!? This is a Hilton chain hotel ... WHERE IS THE CUSTOMER SERVICE TRAINING???!!! It is not rocket science to teach employees to respect clientele which ultimately earns bigger business and better pay etc etc ... am I confused with another planet people!? On a more positive note, the rooms seem still quite new, they offer beds with changeable firmness. This may seem an odd observation however, they have "soft closing" toilet seats! - they don't slam down so your neighbour hears them and consequently your ears don't ring for the next 30 seconds - genious! All of the basic amenities are available in your room - fridge, microwave, free wi-fi, shampoo AND conditioner, weekday USA Today paper, a wonderfully comfy bed, ergonomic chair at desk, plenty of TV channels and the coffee maker. Breakfast is @ $7 to $10 according to hot & cold choices. Reasonably priced according to lack of nutritious options. Being in the middle of no-where there are no lunch options ... some tell lies about a Subway that's within walking distance otherwise they have a "Pavilion pantry" offering basic supplies. Overall, a comfortable and clean hotel stay for a brief hotel stay with all necessary commodities and more - MINUS the customer service attention where staff realize that without the customers they'd be working at MacDonalds (for example). I did not hear one single airplane fly over but I knew exactly each time the air conditioning randomly kicked in, even in slumber; gladly I'm one that finds some comfort in that. I guess the air traffic depends on the weather and the runway? * after all is said and done, the gentleman working the front desk mid-morning did raise the bar for other employees.

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong but no extra aspects to gain higher rating”
Reviews.Author: gwgMimsFlorida
Reviews.Content: My recollection of this hotel is like the hotel, bland. It is a HGInn and everthing worked, met standards but it did not stand out as say HGI Lynchburg or Columbia North East did. A good stop for Michigan to Florida drive.

Reviews.Title: “Airport noise is a problem, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: BETH V
Reviews.Content: The new rooms are very nice and have all the standard amenities. We received a room on the 2nd floor, and I believed noise wouldn't be a problem. However, I was wrong. I awoke several times even though I was wearing earplugs, although my husband & boys slept through the night. We took the shuttle, which was convenient. There is nothing nearby the hotel, other than a Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: ss309556
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here on several trips to the indy area. it is quiet and well maintained. Service is just outstanding, Amy (Manager) always does her best to make sure everyone is happy.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with nothing around it.”
Reviews.Author: AliChicag0
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Garden Inn is very new, and nice. There is shuttle service to and from the Indianapolis airport. The hotel restaurant is ok, the HGI isn't known for having great food. There is a hotel bar adjacent to the restaurant. Just a heads up, there isn't anything around it, nothing! If you don't have a rental car, you are trapped eating at the hotel restaurant, or getting pizza delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again. Some issues at check-in though.”
Reviews.Author: joepa722
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to KC from PA. We arrived around 1 a.m. When I attempted to check in, I had to wait several minutes due to the fact that the attendant seemed to be asleep at the desk in the back office. I yelled "hello" and I heard him startle and jump up. (kind of unprofessional, but it is 1 a.m.). I had booked a rate which combined breakfast with my room rate. I was told that the free breakfast voucher would be in my welcome packet I received with my Hilton Honors envelope. However it was not, so I had to go back down to retreive this from the sleepy front desk attendant. The room was great. Very spacious and clean. Before we left we went to the breakfast area. The staff was fantastic.....very friendly and talkative. They were great with our 3 little boys. Our breakfast was delicious. Despite a bad first impression on check-in....I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport ... and to night time FedEx airplane traffic”
Reviews.Author: briak-ky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to IND airport, which is great if you are on flight arriving in late evening. Down side of the location is that there are no places to eat except inside the hotel without driving a few miles. Rooms are clean and staff is efficient and friendly. Biggest negative of this hotel is that it is directly aligned to the airport runway. Because IND is a secondary hub for FedEx, there is constant airplane traffic during peak sleeping hours. I have stayed at this hotel a few times and have learned to avoid the top floor. All in all, nice hotel if you don't want to drive into downtown/suburbs after arriving in late evening to IND.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: CISmishawaka
Reviews.Content: I was in town on a business trip and stayed at this hotel. I work for Holiday Inn but I decided to try the competition and was very impressed. The restaurant staff was great. Drinks were a little expensive but the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “brand new, beautiful hotel but bring directions”
Reviews.Author: wizofwoz
Reviews.Content: My GPS could not find the address of the hotel so had to bring printed instructions. Even with the directions, you get anxious because you can see the hotel from the road but can't seem to get over there. The road continues passed the hotel so far that just when you think you've missed it, there's a very small sign on the right that tells you to turn left. I was driving in the dark and literally this hotel is in the middle of nowhere so it was not easy...maybe it would have been easier in the daylight. But once I got there, I was very pleasantly pleased. It is brand new (that's why the GPS can't find it) and beautifully decorated. There are many comfortable places to sit in the lobby. The rooms are gorgeous with handsome furnishings and marble bathrooms. Beds are very comfortable with crisp sheets and plenty of pillows. They give you complimentary water bottles. And the rooms were very quiet considering how close you are to the airport. My flight didn't leave till 11 so I slept in with no noise issues. There is no complimentary breakfast but their continental and full breakfast gives you so many choices. I ordered the full breakfast for $9.95 where they cook to your specifications. The waitstaff were extremely friendly and attentive. Besides the restaurant, the Hilton Garden Inn also has a snack shop where you can buy things like microwave pizza. But it's a good thing they have the restaurant because literally they built this hotel in the middle of a field. There is nothing but another hotel on the road. You take exit 68 to get to the hotel but the nearest gas stations, restaurants and stores are on exit 66. If you have a rental car be sure to fill up before going to the hotel because getting to the airport from the hotel is a short drive with nothing on it. I think in time they will build more stuff here but right now there's nothing. But that's not going to stop me from coming back. I felt this was a "find" for an airport hotel and will return. Also their business center is private with 3 computers and stocked with paper and pens...free wireless internet worked great!

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pete7919
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was pleasant. The front desk and serivce staff were very friendly, the rooms were clean and well appointed, and the wifi worked just fine. The place is essentially brand new and has a nice business center, pool, and fitness room. There are also some meeting rooms available if you need them. I had only two minor complaints. First, the location is somewhat remote from anything downtown. It's a good ten miles and even getting into the hotel from the main road is a trip around the block. There's also nothing within walking distance except for another hotel. Second, the bar is way overpriced. $7 for a bottle of beer! I didn't have any problems with airplane noise, and the cookies at dinner time are a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find - Clean, Great Staff, Good for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: ncenjoytravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find and they have 24 hr. transport available to/from the airport. Management must know what they are doing... From the courtesy bus driver, the professional/knowledgeable front desk staff, the restaurant and bar staff, and the housekeeping staff, it shows management knows how to pick the best staff! I felt very comfortable as a female business traveler. The rooms and common areas are very clean. The bus driver went out of his way to help me. The front desk staff provided information about my account/point choices that I didn't even know about. They could even provide me with information about Hilton's other brands. The restaurant and small bar area were lively and the wait/bar staff were quick and friendly. The work out room was nice and functional as was the business center. I didn't use the indoor pool but it looked nice. I'd recommend this hotel for business travelers and families. Although it is somewhat in an isolated area, it is quite and feels very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for early flight”
Reviews.Author: cropguy
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel out near the airport off of I70. It is a great hotel to stay at if you are flying out early. Only 5 min to airport parking. Rooms are very fresh and comfortable. Only downside is planes start taking off at around 4AM. If you are a light sleeper who like to sleep in, this is not the hotel for you. We will definately use this hotel for future travel at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for early flight”
Reviews.Author: TXwonderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn at the end of our college visit trip. The hotel is new and very close to the airport. the hotel is next to the Hampton Inn. There are no restuarants or shops near by. Our room is on the first floor close to the side entrance so we could hear people talking as they entered the hotel. The breakfast selection and quality were good. It is a good choice if you need to get to the airport early, otherwise stay closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for airport but out of the way for everything else”
Reviews.Author: KarenLen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for business for two days. Unless you need access to the airport the location is ordinary. Only high voltage power lines are its neighbours - no other night life in site. We accidentally booked the Hilton Garden Downtown - be careful there are about 3 hotels in Indianapolis called Hilton Garden and it is extremely easy to book at the wrong one like we did. However the booking was quickly fixed although the front desk made me use my mobile phone to cancel the booking at the Downtown hotel. However the hotel is new, staff professional and could not really be faulted except for the desolate location.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: chamomilegardens
Reviews.Content: We accidentally found the hotel through online bargain hunting. I loved it so much that I booked my next stay at the same chain in another city. The staff were spectacular and the hotel was lovely. The first room we were offered was right next to a very noisy toddler and the staff were quick to move us to another floor, which was greatly appreciated. Breakfast was tasty, quick and well worth the price. I did not order room service but the offerings appeared to be priced very fairly. I'd love to see more vegetarian options, however. The only challenge was that my husband did not enjoy the dial adjust beds, as he felt his was too hard.

Reviews.Title: “You wil not sleep....”
Reviews.Author: 52_Weeks_A_Year
Reviews.Content: I have been awake since 4:00 AM and most likely so will you be if you stay here. I have been listening to planes fly "directly" overhead for the last hour or so. They pass every 1.5 minutes (no exaggeration!). Apparently this hotel is directly in the flight path of one of the Fed-Ex hubs. Since the planes are so frequent you do not get a chance to go back to sleep if you are awaken. I stay at Hilton brand hotels almost every week of the year, This property appears to live up to the quality of many other Hilton Garden Inn's I have stayed at with the exception of the location. I have stayed at MANY hotels located adjacent to airports in the past that have not been this bad. The key difference is that consumer flights do not start until 6:00 AM in the worst case and do not fly nearly as frequently as a Fed-Ex Hub evacuating it's cargo. Note there is a Hampton Inn next door and the planes are flying right between the hotels. So I doubt that option would be any better. I will not stay at either one of these properties again.

Reviews.Title: “A great conference site”
Reviews.Author: MNfemrail
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Airport for a conference. Everything said in the other reviews about the employees was true for our group -- superb, personalized service! Lots of smiles! Rooms comfortable and clean. The food for our group was especially good and plentiful. Served on schedule. The breakfast in the Grill was plentiful -- a combination of buffet (fruits, cold cereals, juice, breads & rolls) and order (eggs, pancakes, etc., and oatmeal). I appreciated the business center which had free access to internet & options for printing, etc. The hotel provides shuttle to and from the airport (even at 1 am!) with same friendly attitude. I heard that they also take patrons to the nearby mall, but I didn't need that service. If you have no car, getting to the downtown is a little more difficult.

Reviews.Title: “The employees are awesome!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: catopurple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed @ this hotel before we flew out for our honeymoon. The rooms were awesome and the staff was even better. I will be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, excellent....!”
Reviews.Author: george107
Reviews.Content: Bright, new, clean hotel with great rooms and service! Every hotel staff person was knowledgeable and friendly. Room was spotless. Bed was VERY comfortable. I can’t say enough about the staff. One printed out directions for me. Another stored my luggage for the day and would not take money for it. In short...excellent. One can't go wrong by staying here!
